info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 1:50AM MST until November 24 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches, with isolated amounts approaching 5 inches in northerly upslope favored locations. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Canyon Ferry Area, Helena Valley, Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft, and Gallatin Valley. * WHEN...From midnight Wednesday Night to 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong and gusty north winds through the north-south orientated valleys of Southwest and Central Montana will lead to periods of reduced visibility from blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
